Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tacrolimus QD vs. BD in Kidney Transplantation

Trial_Design.evidence: In this open-label, parallel-group trial, 1198 adults with end-stage renal disease undergoing kidney transplantation were randomised

Participants.evidence: 1198 adults with end-stage renal disease undergoing kidney transplantation

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive tacrolimus BD 0.2 mg/kg/day (Arm 1), QD 0.2 mg/kg/day (Arm 2), QD 0.3 mg/kg/day (Arm 3), or QD 0.2 mg/kg/day with basiliximab (Arm 4)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated the efficacy of once-daily (QD) tacrolimus compared to twice-daily (BD) tacrolimus in kidney transplant recipients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was efficacy failure (graft loss, biopsy-confirmed acute rejection, or graft dysfunction) at 24 weeks.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 1198 adults with end-stage renal disease undergoing kidney transplantation were randomised

Result_Outcome.evidence: Noninferiority was demonstrated for Arm 2 versus Arm 1 (difference, −1.6%; 95% CI, −12.2% to 9.0%).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar across groups.
